config.question: Which of these was important in bringing about the end of the Federalist party?

choices.content: the resolutions of the Hartford Convention
Federalist support for England during the war
the routing of the Shawnee during the battle of Tippecanoe
Federalist opposition to limiting the terms of presidents

answer_3.response: The resolutions of the Hartford Convention, criticizing the war and the Constitution, proved an embarrassment for the Federalists and accelerated their demise as a political party. People throughout the country were persuaded that wild secessionists had attempted to destroy the Union.
